topics.body:
"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5516fdc0636872652c7a0000#post_5516fdc0636872652c7a0000
Before we talk about something else I would like to point out a massive fallacy in the news:
!http://www.aei.org/wp-content/uploads/2015/01/gender1.jpg!
!http://content.gallup.com/origin/gallupinc/GallupSpaces/Production/Cms/POLL/ldah6rdp6ukvngoyqi1fcg.gif!


*VIOLENT* crime per thousand in the usa is at a record low.  Why does the news constantly talk about violent crime in the usa?  To make a theory I would have to say that violence sells and the same goes for the news; the more you talk about crime in the news the more viewers you get.

"The world is actually a more peaceful place":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ramBFRt1Uzk
For every 100000 people only 3/10ths of a person die in war now. Citation is "The Better Angels of Our Nature: Why Violence Has Declined"
Genocide was 1400 times higher in 1942 than 2008
There's only 25 authoritarian governments left.
Over a 100 democracies in the world.
Murder per 100000 in the usa is at a record low.


"The world is getting more violent!"... No; the human brain is hard wired to be pessimistic; it's a evolutionary survival trait.











*TL:DR; AT THE CURRENT RATE BY 2100 THERE WON'T BE RAPES ANYMORE, THERE WON'T BE MURDER, THERE WON'T BE WAR.*
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
